content.description: Start on the low angle slab on the right side of boulder. Move up and left to good rail in middle of face. Using a left hand side pull, move to the lip!  Kapow!
content.location: Starts on the obvious low angle slab on right side of wave

content.description: Start on the shelf on the left side of the wave. Hit a left side pull and pull into the flake jugs to finish
content.location: On the left side of the wave. Obvious starting shelf

content.description: Start the same as tidal wave.  On a nice big left facing rail. Move up and left on some weird small holds to a match on a mediocre crimp about 3/4 way up make one more move out left and then connect with route that starts on shelf (aka a deadpoint to a nice big flake/block.  A left handed bump to a small two finger sloper crimp about five moves in  was the crux for me. super temperature dependent feels so hard in warm temps.
content.protection: A couple pads are pretty nice if your doing it when the snow is not over the sharp jagged rock below.
content.location: Left of wavecatcher and rider.  Right of knife dance boulder.  Directly in front of Crimp ladder boulder.
